title: Ferenc Nagy (boxer)
text:
Ferenc Nagy (27 October 1916 – 11 May 1977) was a <a href="Hungary">Hungarian</a> <a href="Boxing">boxer</a> who competed in the <a href="1936%20Summer%20Olympics">1936 Summer Olympics</a>.
He was born in <a href="Cegl%C3%A9d">Cegléd</a>.
In 1936 he finished fourth in the <a href="Boxing%20at%20the%201936%20Summer%20Olympics%20-%20Men%27s%20heavyweight">heavyweight class</a>. After his win in the quarterfinals against <a href="Olle%20Tandberg">Olle Tandberg</a> he was neither able to fight in the semifinal bout to <a href="Herbert%20Runge">Herbert Runge</a> nor in the bronze medal bout to <a href="Erling%20Nilsen">Erling Nilsen</a>.
He wasn't able to fight for the medal because he was locked in to the locker room and his trainer was ordered to throw in the towel. There was a clear political reason behind this and sadly the medal placement was already decided. 
See reference Cegled Sport torteneti Muzem**.
